content:
I think I can handle it with your guidance. I'll make sure to turn off the water supply and disconnect the chain before removing the old flapper. And I'll inspect and clean the area to ensure a good seal with the new flapper.

I did buy a replacement flapper that's compatible with my toilet model, so I'm good to go there. I'll take my time and work carefully to avoid damaging anything.

If I run into any issues or have any questions, I'll definitely look up a YouTube tutorial or come back to chat with you. But I'm feeling fairly confident that I can replace the flapper successfully.

Thanks again for your help and advice!
